member.name: P:org.in2bits.MyOle2.Msat.SID0
member.summary: Gets the SID0, or SID of the first sector, of the MSAT. If SectorCount is 0 (zero), the SID0 will return -2. Currently, 0 is the only value other than -2 returned, as the current MyOle2 implementation always places any MSAT sectors as the first sectors in the document.

member.name: T:org.in2bits.MyXls.XlsDocument
member.summary: The root class of MyXls, containing general configuration properties and references to the Workbook as well as the MyOle2 Document which will contain and format the workbook when Sending or Saving.

member.name: M:org.in2bits.MyXls.XlsDocument.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the XlsDocument class.

member.name: M:org.in2bits.MyXls.XlsDocument.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new XlsDocument from the provided file, reading in as much information from the file as possible and representing it appropriately with MyXls objects (Workbook, Worksheets, Cells, etc.).
member.param: The name of the file to read into this XlsDocument.

member.name: M:org.in2bits.MyXls.XlsDocument.#ctor(System.Data.DataSet)
member.summary: Initializes a new XlsDocument from the provided DataSet. Each Table in the DataSet will be written to a separate Worksheet. The data for each table will be written starting at A1 on each sheet, with a Header Row (A1 will be the name of the first Column, A2 will be the first value).
member.param: The DataSet to write to this XlsDocument.

member.name: M:org.in2bits.MyXls.XlsDocument.Send
member.summary: Valid in an ASP.NET context only. Sends this XlsDocument to the client with the given FileName as an attachment file, via the HttpResponse object. Clears the Response before sending and ends the Response after sending.

member.name: M:org.in2bits.MyXls.XlsDocument.Send(org.in2bits.MyXls.XlsDocument.SendMethods)
member.summary: Valid in an ASP.NET context only. Sends this XlsDocument to the client with the given FileName as an attached or inline file, via the HttpResponse object. Clears the Response before sending and ends the Response after sending.
member.param: Method to use to send document.

member.name: M:org.in2bits.MyXls.XlsDocument.Save(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Save this XlsDocument to the Current Directory. The FileName property will be used for the FileName.
member.param: Whether to overwrite if the specified file already exists.

member.name: M:org.in2bits.MyXls.XlsDocument.Save
member.summary: Save this XlsDocument to the Current Directory. The FileName property will be used for the FileName. Will not overwrite.

member.name: M:org.in2bits.MyXls.XlsDocument.Save(System.String)
member.summary: Save this XlsDocument to the given path. The FileName property will be used for the FileName. Will not overwrite.
member.param: The Path to which to save this XlsDocument.

member.name: M:org.in2bits.MyXls.XlsDocument.Save(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Save this XlsDocument to the given path. The FileName property will be used for the FileName.

member.summary: Gets whether this Ole2Document should be encoded in Little Endian (or Big Endian) format. Currently only Little Endian is supported.

member.name: P:org.in2bits.MyOle2.Ole2Document.SectorSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the Sector Size of this Ole2Document. This is the number of bytes per standard sector as a power of 2 (e.g. setting this to 9 sets the BytesPerSector to 2 ^ 9 or 512). This is not normally changed from its default of 9.

member.name: P:org.in2bits.MyOle2.Ole2Document.ShortSectorSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the Short Sector Size of this Ole2Document. This is the number of bytes per short sector as a power of 2 (e.g. setting this to 6 sets the BytesPerShortSector to 2 ^ 6 or 128). This is not normally changed from its default of 6.

member.name: P:org.in2bits.MyOle2.Ole2Document.Bytes
member.summary: Gets a Bytes object containing all the bytes of this Ole2Document. This Bytes object's ByteArray is what should be saved to disk to persist this Ole2Document as a file on disk.

member.summary: Gets a blank array of bytes. Included as documented filler field.
